resources.string: Insert memory card to use Camera.
Not enough memory. Default storage is changed to memory card
Not enough memory. Default storage is changed to phone memory
Not enough space on SD card. Default storage has been changed to device storage
Exit Camera. Battery temperature too high
Unable to turn on the flash. Try again when your device has cooled down.
The flash has been turned off. You can turn on the flash when your device has cooled down.
Recording has stopped. You can record when your device has cooled down.
Unable to record in Dual camera mode. Try again when your device has cooled down.
Unable to record video. Try again when device cooled down.
Unable to record. Resolution type not supported by memory card
Unable to use Camera during calls.
Unable to record videos during call.
Automatically adjusts the exposure to optimize the color and brightness of pictures. You can take single or burst shots.
Automatically adjusts the exposure to optimize the color and brightness of pictures.
Take flawless portrait pictures with an airbrushed effect. This function may not work when it is too dark or when the subject is too close to the camera.
Take a series of pictures, and then select the best to save.
Take pictures continuously at a rate of %d per second.
Select the best picture of each person from 5 consecutive pictures to get the best merged group picture.
Save the best picture after erasing moving objects from %d consecutive pictures.
Take multiple exposure pictures of a moving subject and merge them into one dramatic picture.
Create a linear panorama by taking pictures in either a horizontal or vertical direction.
Create a spherical panorama of your surroundings.
Take pictures with softer or richer colors by merging pictures taken in various exposures.
Enrich your pictures by adding a few seconds of background sound.
Create a picture containing selected moving objects by animating certain parts of the picture.
Take brighter, clearer pictures in low light without flash.
Take clearer pictures of fast moving subjects.
Take pictures of a golf-swing. You can then play the pictures forwards or backwards.
You can take pictures and record videos using the front and rear cameras at the same time. A variety of picture-in-picture styles are available.
Select the objects to draw into focus. For best results, make sure your subjects are not too close to the background.
Explore the various effects available for burst shots. Effects can be applied right after taking your pictures or in Studio. The following effects are available in %1$s: %2$s
Create interactive virtual tours of your surroundings.
The multi preview feature is not supported for downloaded effects. They will be shown in the sample images rather than in previews.
You are able to take pictures while recording. However, the actual picture taken will have a wider view than the preview due to the VDIS algorithm.
Place the subject in the center, then press the shutter key.
Hold the device steady and let the subject of your picture move while you are taking pictures.
Hold the device steady until it finishes taking the picture.
Hold the device steady while taking pictures. To take instant pictures in low light, disable Picture stabilisation in Settings.
Tap the camera button to detect moving objects, then select the objects you want to animate or freeze.
Select an object to be focused on that is less than 50 cm away from the device.
Tap the camera button, then move the device slowly in one direction.
Press the camera key and move device slowly in one direction.
To start taking a Virtual tour shot, place the target pointer in the center of the circle.

Enabling Location tags will attach, embed and store geographical location data within each picture that you take. Use caution when you send, share, distribute, transmit or copy these pictures since they contain information about where the picture was taken.
Data will be transferred in the background when the device is connected to a mobile network or WLAN
Turn on GPS in Settings to use GPS tag.
Tap the camera button. Take pictures automatically when subject smiles
Change default storage to memory card?
Insert memory card to use Camera.
Press screen to focus on tapped area.
SD card inserted. %s is closed to scan media files on SD card
Camera closed due to media file scanning.
Turn off USB storage before using camera.
Glue feature only supported when using rear camera.
Unable to stick PiP image to this area. Adjust size and position of PiP image and try again.
Database storage space is nearly full.
Default storage changed to phone memory.
Default storage changed to memory card.
Security policy restricts the use of Camera.
Security policy restricts use of Camera. Exit Camera
Unable to save file to SD card. Default storage has been changed to device memory.
Unlock device to view all images and videos.
Auto night detection cannot be used while recording videos.
Smart stabilization cannot be used while recording videos.
To change modes, you need at least %d MB of free space in your device memory.
Unable to record videos with effects in %s. Change video size in Settings.
Cannot zoom in or out in this mode.
Unable to zoom when picture size set to maximum.
Unable to use flash. Battery power low.
Cannot use flash in low temperature.
Receive photos while Camera not in use
Share shot lets you share pictures with other devices using Wi-Fi Direct. Wi-Fi Direct connection is required.
To easily connect to the device, turn on NFC and bring the devices together back to back.
An SD card has been inserted. The default storage location will be changed to SD card.

An SD card has been inserted. The default storage location will be changed to the SD card. Single shots will be saved to the SD card. However, burst shots and pictures taken using some downloaded camera modes will still be saved to the device storage.
Select each best face to save
Close Camera. Battery temperature too low.
Take and share photos with friends via face detection.
Double tap on a face to zoom in or out.
Burst shots will be saved to device storage.
The best photos will be saved to device storage.

"To capture the movement of your subject across the entire screen, give them enough space to move from one side of the camera's preview screen to the other. Hold the device still while taking pictures."
Moving objects, such as passers-by, will be erased from your pictures automatically. You can then restore any of the erased objects. Stationary objects cannot be erased.

An animated photo is a still image that contains some moving objects. When you tap the camera button, moving objects will be detected by the device and you can then select which objects to animate or freeze.
In darker environments, like indoors, shots may be difficult to process and the screen may flicker.
The default storage location will be changed to the SD card. However, burst shots and pictures taken using some downloaded camera modes will still be saved to the device storage.
Single shots will be saved to the SD card. Continuous shots will be saved to the device storage.
Unable to use the recording snapshot function while anti-shake is enabled.
The resolution is set to %s (default). The resolution can be changed under settings
Pictures taken using Remote viewfinder can only be viewed on this device. Tap OK to end this remote session and go to Gallery.
Pictures taken using Remote viewfinder can only be viewed on this device. Tap OK to end this remote session and go to %s.

You are currently connected to another device via Wi-Fi Direct. Tap OK to use the Wi-Fi Direct connected device as a remote viewfinder. To use a different device as a remote viewfinder, disconnect your current Wi-Fi Direct connection in Settings.

You are currently connected to another device via WLAN Direct. Tap OK to use the WLAN Direct connected device as a remote viewfinder. To use a different device as a remote viewfinder, disconnect your current WLAN Direct connection in Settings.
This feature can only be accessed on the main device. The remote viewfinder session will end.

%s is a camera feature which integrates the image from your front camera screen into billboards, posters and signs detected in the image on your rear camera screen. Resize and drag the image from your front camera screen and insert it into an area on your rear screen. Your camera will then start tracking the area you selected to keep the image from the rear camera positioned correctly.
Browse the various effects available for burst shots. Effects can be applied right after taking your pictures or later, in Studio. The following effects are available in %s:
Best photo: Select the best from a series of pictures.
Best face: Select the best picture of each person from a series of pictures.
Drama: Take a series of pictures of a moving object, then merge them.
Eraser: Erase unwanted moving objects from your picture.
Panning shot: Capture a sense of motion when taking pictures of moving objects.
Hold the device steady while taking pictures.
You will be unable to use the touch screen underwater. Use the volume key as the camera or record key. Selecting this option will change the volume key settings.
Before putting the device underwater, be sure to close the USB cover.
For protection against water damage, firmly seal the battery and charging covers before use. Make sure to press below the camera flash.
ChatON photo share allows you to send pictures to your ChatON buddies as you take them. Install ChatON?
File size exceeds maximum upload limit.
Self shot can only be used when the phone is open.
Self recording can only be used when the phone is open.
The recording has been stopped because the phone has been closed.
Dual camera mode can only be used when the device is open.
Self shot only available when flip phone is open.
Unable to take panoramic picture because of lack of scenery detail.
Unable to take pictures of golf-swings in Portrait view.
Remote viewfinder allows you to take pictures using the viewfinder of a connected device. Wi-Fi Direct connection is required.
Remote viewfinder allows you to take pictures using the viewfinder of a connected device. WLAN Direct connection is required.
You can keep taking pictures. Up to the previous %d seconds of recorded sound will be saved with each picture.
Background sound will be recorded for up to %d seconds after you tap the camera button.
Record files using your custom size settings.
Limit the file sizes of your recordings for sharing via Messages.
Record files at a high frame rate for viewing in slow motion.
Record files for viewing in fast motion.
Record files at 60 fps for clearer and smoother viewing.
Share pictures with other devices using the share shot menu provided via Wi-Fi Direct.
Share pictures with other devices using the share shot menu provided via WLAN Direct.
Share pictures with your friends and contacts whose faces have been detected.
Take and share photos with your buddies via ChatON.
Take and share pictures with your friends via direct share.
Take pictures using the viewfinder of a connected device.
Take brighter and clearer pictures without using the flash in low light. Your device will automatically detect low light levels and adjust the camera accordingly.
Hold your device steady while taking pictures in the dark.
Tap and hold the camera button to take burst shots.
The camera will detect and focus on faces if any appear in the preview.
Anti-shake prevents blurring by speeding up the shutter.
Stabilises the display when you record videos.
Show grid lines on the camera viewfinder.
Attaches, embeds and stores geographical location data within each picture.

"Tap and hold the camera button to take a burst shot.
Burst shots will always be saved to the device memory."
View pictures and videos immediately after you take or record them.
Make objects stand out from the background. They must be less than 50 cm away from you, and at least three times this distance from the background.
While recording videos, zooming in on an object will amplify sound from that area and diminish the surrounding sound.
Tap the camera button to take a picture.
Tap and hold the camera button to take burst shots.
Tap and hold a spot on the screen, then release to take a picture that is focused on that spot.
Tap the camcorder button to record videos.
Tap to take picture while recording.
Tap the stop button to stop recording.
Tap the mode button to select a camera mode.
Tap each mode to see a description of that mode.
Tap the dual button to enable Dual camera mode and preview the dual picture.
Tap the switch button to switch between the front and rear cameras.
Tap the PiP (picture in picture), then drag it, or resize it using the borders.
Tap this button to select a style.
Tap the camera button to take pictures using the front and rear cameras at the same time.
Tap and hold icons, then drag them to change their positions in the shortcut menu.
The remote viewfinder device has been disconnected.
The device you are trying to connect to does not support remote viewfinder.
Drama shot process stopped early. Only pictures taken so far will be combined. For better results with drama shot, make sure subject does not take up too much of screen.
Drama shot process stopped early. Only pictures taken so far will be combined. For better results with drama shot, make sure there is a moving object of reasonable size.
Drama shot process stopped early. Only pictures taken so far will be combined. For better results with drama shot, take pictures where only one subject moves.
Continuous shots will be saved to device memory.
To enhance TalkBack in Camera, Face detection and Voice control will be enabled.
When you zoom in on an area while recording, the microphone will focus on the sound from that area.
Sound & shot mode has been enabled. This mode lets you record sounds that are saved with the pictures you take.
More than %d faces have been detected.
Unable to enable the voice guide. Enable TalkBack and try again.
1 face detected and located on left-hand side of screen.
1 face detected and located on right-hand side of screen.
1 face detected and located in center of screen.
%d faces have been detected. The camera is focused on the person to the center.
%d faces have been detected. The camera is focused on the person to the left.
%d faces have been detected. The camera is focused on the person to the right.
%d faces have been detected. Focus is on face on left.
%d faces have been detected. Focus is on face on right.
%d faces have been detected. Focus is on the face in center.
More than %d faces have been detected.
1 face has been detected and is located on the upper left side of the screen.
1 face has been detected and located on left side of screen.
1 face has been detected and is located on the lower left side of the screen.
1 face has been detected and is located on the upper right side of the screen.
1 face has been detected and located on right side of screen.
1 face has been detected and is located on the lower right side of the screen.
1 face has been detected and is located in the centre at the top of the screen.
1 face has been detected and located in centre of screen.
1 face has been detected and is located in the center at the bottom of the screen.
To take a picture, place the target pointer in the center of the circle.
Create a spherical panorama of your surroundings by combining pictures. For the best results, do not stand too close to the subject and maintain a constant distance between yourself and the camera.
Unable to open Camera while using SideSync.
"The following will be unavailable while recording in %s resolution: - Dual camera mode - HDR (Rich tone) - Video effects - Remote viewfinder - Taking pictures while recording video"
The video codec is currently being used by other applications. Close any other active video applications in Task Manager and try again.
Additional help content must be downloaded. Mobile data will be used if you download data without connecting via Wi-Fi network. You will be taken to the download screen.
Take pictures easily by tapping the side of the device as indicated by the guide image. This function is not supported in Portrait mode, Easy mode and while recording video.
Access Camera quickly and directly from the lock screen. Using both hands, hold the device in landscape orientation with the rear camera facing forwards.
Go straight ahead or stop to take picture.
Turn left or stop to take picture.
Turn right or stop to take picture.
Unable to take any more pictures. Device unsteady or turned too quickly. Pictures taken until now saved.
"Go straight ahead or stop to take picture. %d steps remaining."
Unable to take picture. Maximum distance exceeded.
Go straight ahead, or turn left or right to take your next picture.
Hold the device steady while taking pictures.
Unable to take any more pictures. Device rotated. Pictures taken until now saved.
Out of range. Unable to take more pictures.
This application will install a camera mode on your device which will interact with the Camera application. Be aware that malicious software may result in unstable Camera functionality.
Picture saved, but unable to apply Focus contrast effect. Select area to focus on and try again.
Picture saved, but unable to apply Focus contrast effect. Subject too far away.
Picture saved, but unable to apply Focus contrast effect. Subject not detected.
%s cannot be used while recording videos.
Burst shots not supported while %s enabled.
Tap and hold the icons, then drag them to change their positions.
The quick settings layout will be reset to the default settings.
